indicator: Children in Reception Year classified as obese
description: Percentage of children in Reception Year classified as obese. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of children measured as obese.

indicator: Children in Year 6 classified as obese
description: Percentage of children in Year 6 (aged 10-11) classified as obese. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of children measured as obese.
Ratio of the observed number of hospital stays for self harm in an area to the number expected if the area had the same age-specific rates as England. Higher ratios indicate more self harm.

source: Public Health England/Office for National Statistics
description: Average number of years that a female is expected to live based on current mortality rates.
Average number of years that a male is expected to live based on current mortality rates.
Average number of years that a female is expected to live in a state of self-assessed good or very good health, based on current mortality rates and prevalence of good or very good health.
Average number of years that a male is expected to live in a state of self-assessed good or very good health, based on current mortality rates and prevalence of good or very good health.
The number of people killed or seriously injured in road traffic accidents.

Percentage of those aged 16 and above who binge drink. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of adults who consume at least twice the daily recommended amount of alcohol in a single drinking session.
Ratio of the observed number of incidences of breast cancer in an area to the number expected if the area had the same age-specific rates as England. Higher ratios indicate more cases.
Ratio of the observed number of incidences of cancer in an area to the number expected if the area had the same age-specific rates as England. Higher ratios indicate more cases.
Ratio of the observed number of deaths from cancer in an area to the number expected if the area had the same age-specific rates as England. Higher ratios indicate more deaths.
Percentage of 5 year olds who have reached a Good Level of Development.
Live births per 1,000 women aged 15-44 years.
Percentage of full term babies born with a low birth weight. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of babies are born under 2500g.
Percentage of adults classified as obese. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of the adult population exceeding 30kg/m<sup>2</sup>

indicator: Deaths from circulatory disease amongst those aged under 75 years
description: Ratio of the observed number of deaths from circulatory disease amongst those aged under 75 years in an area to the number expected if the area had the same age-specific rates as England. Higher ratios indicate more deaths.
Ratio of the observed number of deaths from respiratory diseases in an area to the number expected if the area had the same age-specific rates as England. Higher ratios indicate more deaths.

indicator: People reporting their general health as bad or very bad
description: Percentage of people who report their general health as "Bad" or "Very bad". Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of the population reporting poor health.

Ratio of the observed number of hospital stays for alcohol-related harm in an area to the number expected if the area had the same age-specific rates as England. Higher ratios indicate more self harm.
Percentage of residents aged 65 years or more that are living alone. Higher percentages indicate a larger proportion of older residents living alone.
